title: Friction - force on stone on train car

content.description: A train car carrying an <math alttext="800 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mn>800</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math> stone is moving to the right with constant speed <math alttext="v sub T equals 20 meters per second" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <msub> <mi>v</mi> <mtext>T</mtext> </msub> <mo>=</mo> <mn>20</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>m/s</mtext> </mstyle> </math>. The stone is at rest relative to the train car. The coefficients of static and kinetic friction for the stone on the train car’s surface are <math alttext="0.30" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.30</mn></math> and <math alttext="0.15" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.15</mn></math>, respectively.
content.question: What is the magnitude of the force of friction exerted on the stone by the train car?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.2 times 10 cubed newtons" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>3</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>
<math alttext="2.4 times 10 cubed newtons" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>3</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>
<math alttext="16 times 10 cubed newtons" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mn>3</mn></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
